subject: [Lab 12] Q3: Obedience
content:
Q3: Obedience

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q3: Obedience in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: Why did I get this error when I wrote the code in the order provided?  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjcauk1ond7y5vl%2Fk385ny0zjvgb%2FScreen_Shot_20191120_at_7.27.02_PM.png)

follow-ups.feedback: Are you filtering your results at all? You shouldn’t be, but it looks like you only have 6 rows in your resulting table, which is much less than it should be. We want simply a table that contains the seven and the professor for **every row** , so no filtering involved.

threads.question: Does anyone know why I'm not passing the test  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjr5jsrrl8lt56h%2Fk39ekxfg7ng9%2F1.png)

follow-ups.feedback: I think you might have a syntax error on some other part of the SQL file, since Ok is seeing some error message coming before the actual printed table.

threads.question: ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzkuxvyq8385iy%2Fk3997fnwjptj%2F1.png)  I write 10 rows in my tables, and it ordered and filter automatically. I don't know how to solve it.

follow-ups.feedback: What do you mean “automatically”? Do you mean it’s doing it even though you don’t have any `ORDER BY` statements?
Yeah, I think so. I already posted my code in another place privately, can you help me to check it.
No, I can’t, unfortunately. Only the instructors can see private posts, and I am not an instructor.
can I post it here?
no. Make a private post if you're sharing code.
Is there a solution for this? I'm getting the same error without any order by statements

That is… very odd. I don’t think we’re going to be of any help, unfortunately. I’ll bump it to the instructors, but worst-case scenario, if you really are doing it right (and I don’t think that is a super difficult feat for this question), just submit it to Ok as long as it’s working on the online interpreter, and you can make a note to them that your SQLite is being weird and sorting things for you. They can adjust your final grade for the lab, anyway.
yeah. sql doesn't guarantee ordering so I don't know why they would run test cases without order by

threads.question: Im not sure if i am running my terminal command incorrectly, but I am trying to run python3 ok -q obedience while I'm cd'd in my lab12 folder. What am i doing wrong?  ![](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjzkv017wndk6xr%2Fk3apl8tdxbxj%2FScreen_Shot_20191122_at_2.21.00_PM.png)

follow-ups.feedback: Looks like you have a syntax error in the statement constructing the obedience table.
I tried running the next table too and it did the same thing, it was exactly how I opened the file. I should be entering the python3 command for each problem of sql in the lab12 folder right?
Did you implement your solutions yet?
Yes for the first two questions
That's really weird. Perhaps see if you can manually load in the SQL file via the shell and select all the elements from the tables you've made?

^ What Cyrus said. You should be able to load the file with `sqlite3 --init lab12.sql` if you are using a binary or `python3 sqlite_shell.py --init lab12.sql` if you are just using the Python shell. I *strongly* recommend getting the binary if you haven’t.
Ah, whoops, I just realized you fixed it on the next thread. Never mind. Still get the binary, though!

threads.question: Not sure what it was but I deleted the folder and redownloaded it, and now it works, super weird.. Thanks though!

follow-ups.feedback: oops this was supposed to be for the above post ^^ lol
All good, glad it works!

threads.question: I wrote my code, but I get the error: near "from": syntax error. Any ideas on what could be wrong?

follow-ups.feedback: I used "from" to inherit from the students table
Make sure your code is of the form `SELECT [columns] FROM [table];`, using commas between column names if you have more than one.
Thanks, didn't realize I only needed one "from"
